result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mason John Tomkiewicz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mason John Tomkiewicz appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley appeared by video for Mason John Tomkiewicz.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. State is in compliance with victim notification. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mason John Tomkiewicz in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mason John Tomkiewicz appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY. 
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests additional time as defendant has a pending felony matter (22CF169) in Ozaukee County.  
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mason John Tomkiewicz in court with Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defense requests a scheduling date.  Court set date as requested.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Mason John Tomkiewicz in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-5-2022 @1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07/05/2022@1pm
